name: The Great Gatsby
description: A classic novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald, exploring themes of wealth, love, and the American Dream.

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: Harper Lee's masterpiece addressing racial injustice and moral growth in the American South.

name: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
description: A humorous sci-fi series by Douglas Adams, following the misadventures of Arthur Dent in space.
George Orwell's classic depicting a totalitarian future where freedom is restricted.

name: Pride and Prejudice
description: Jane Austen's timeless novel exploring love, class, and societal expectations.

name: The Hobbit
description: J.R.R. Tolkien's adventure of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit on a quest for treasure guarded by a dragon.

name: The Catcher in the Rye
description: J.D. Salinger's novel capturing the angst and alienation of a teenage protagonist.

name: The Da Vinci Code
description: Dan Brown's thrilling mystery involving symbolism, art, and ancient secrets.

name: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
description: J.K. Rowling's magical tale introducing the wizarding world and the young wizard Harry Potter.

name: The Lord of the Rings
description: J.R.R. Tolkien's epic trilogy following the quest to destroy the One Ring and save Middle-earth.

name: The Hunger Games
description: Suzanne Collins' gripping series depicting a dystopian society where teenagers fight to the death for entertainment.
